title: How to Make Cranberry Vinegar

steps.headline: Wash the cranberries.
steps.description: Remove any foreign items and dirt.

steps.headline: Allow the cranberries to dry.
steps.description: This is easiest if you place them on kitchen paper towel that has been arranged over a wire cake rack.

steps.headline: Pack the cranberries into the container of choice.
steps.description: Fill three quarters of the way.

steps.headline: Heat the vinegar to boiling point and remove as soon as it reaches this point.
Pour the vinegar over the packed cranberries.
steps.description: Add any more cranberries if room, otherwise pop on the lid.

steps.headline: Put the vinegar into a sunny place, such as the windowsill and let the vinegar infuse.
steps.description: Leave it for at least 2 weeks. If it is not a very sunny time of year, leave longer.

steps.headline: Taste it.
steps.description: If you like the flavour, it is ready to use. If not, strain out the vinegar, add more cranberries to the container (pack down well) and pour the strained vinegar back in.

steps.headline: Use it!
steps.description: Add to dressings for salads, including meat-based salads (great for leftover turkey).

tyn: Storage bottle, jar etc. that has been properly sterilised before use, with lid or cover
Decorative elements if giving as a gift
text: Wash the cranberries. Remove any foreign items and dirt. Allow the cranberries to dry. This is easiest if you place them on kitchen paper towel that has been arranged over a wire cake rack. Pack the cranberries into the container of choice. Fill three quarters of the way. Heat the vinegar to boiling point and remove as soon as it reaches this point.  Pour the vinegar over the packed cranberries. Add any more cranberries if room, otherwise pop on the lid. Put the vinegar into a sunny place, such as the windowsill and let the vinegar infuse. Leave it for at least 2 weeks. If it is not a very sunny time of year, leave longer. Taste it. If you like the flavour, it is ready to use. If not, strain out the vinegar, add more cranberries to the container (pack down well) and pour the strained vinegar back in. Use it! Add to dressings for salads, including meat-based salads (great for leftover turkey). Finished.
